title: Advanced SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Adam Feldstein February 7, 2018 A Look Back at a Great 2017: 5 Major Moz Product Investments and a Sneak Peek Into 2018 Moz Tools | Advanced SEO | Moz News We spent much of 2017 improving and reinforcing our SEO products to better serve the experts who use them. Check out the biggest updates from the past year, and get a sneak peek at what we have planned for 2018! Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 11, 2018 9 Predictions for SEO in 2018 Marketing Industry | Advanced SEO | Social Media For the past ten years, Rand has made a set of predictions for SEO in the year ahead, and for all ten years he's been largely correct. Check out what he got right in 2017, and pay close attention to his predictions for 2018 — they're doozies! Read this post By: Rand Fishkin January 5, 2018 SEO Ranking Factors & Correlation: What Does It Mean When a Metric Is Correlated with Google Rankings? Advanced SEO | Whiteboard Friday Correlations data isn't always as clear as it seems. In this Whiteboard Friday, Rand shares the myths and realities of correlations in SEO ranking factor studies, then offers five smart ways to glean more trustworthy, useful information from the data. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin December 29, 2017 How to Rank: The SEO Checklist Advanced SEO | Whiteboard Friday This edition of Whiteboard Friday covers a nine-point SEO checklist of the major items you need to cross off to rank in 2018 — and maybe get some hints on how to explain it to others, too. Read this post By: Felicia Crawford December 28, 2017 The Very Best of the Moz Blog 2017: Our Top 50 Posts Moz News | Advanced SEO | SEO Basics We've curated a hefty list of the Moz Blog's top posts throughout the year, covering all of our most popular categories. Come check out what you may have missed, see which community members made the Top 10 Comments, and help us ring in 2018 right! Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers December 19, 2017 How Long Should Your Meta Description Be? Advanced SEO | Technical SEO The end of November saw a spike in the average length of SERP snippets. Across 90K results, we found a definite increase but many oddities, such as video snippets. Our data suggests that many snippets are exceeding 300 characters, and we recommend a new meta description limit of 300 characters. Read this post By: Tom Bennet November 29, 2017 The Complete Guide to Direct Traffic in Google Analytics SEO Analytics | SEO Reporting | Advanced SEO Looking to reduce the level of direct traffic in your Google Analytics reports? This guide defines exactly what constitutes direct traffic and how to combat it in your reports for better data. Read this post By: Eric Enge November 21, 2017 AMP-lify Your Digital Marketing in 2018 Mobile SEO | SEO Analytics | Advanced SEO AMP can offer some serious benefits, even for e-commerce (one business saw conversion rates improve 100%), but implementing it sloppily will come back to haunt you. Check out case studies and analyses that just may convince you to accelerate your mobile pages in 2018. Read this post By: Rand Fishkin November 17, 2017 How Google AdWords (PPC) Does and Doesn't Affect Organic Results Paid Search Marketing (PPC) | Whiteboard Friday | Advanced SEO We're well aware that PPC can have an effect on our organic results. But what effect is that, exactly, and how does it work? This week's Whiteboard Friday covers the ways paid influences organic — and one very important way it doesn't. Read this post By: Alexis Sanders October 18, 2017 Unlocking Hidden Gems Within Schema.org Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Schema.org can be a confusing resource if you're trying to learn how to use and implement structured data. This mini-guide arms you with the right kind of thinking to tackle your next structured data project. Read this post By: Bartosz Góralewicz October 16, 2017 Google Shares Details About the Technology Behind Googlebot Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO It's been revealed that version 41 of the Google Chrome browser is the technology behind Google's crawler. What does this mean for developers, and how can you use this in your own SEO toolkit? Read this post By: Bartosz Góralewicz October 16, 2017 Does Googlebot Support HTTP/2? Challenging Google's Indexing Claims – An Experiment Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO Googlebot can't crawl or index sites using HTTP/2 alone. Based on the results of this experiment, you may want to continue optimizing for HTTP/1.1 as well. Read this post By: Zee Hoffmann Jones October 2, 2017 The SEO Competitive Analysis Checklist Competitive Research | Advanced SEO This comprehensive competitive analysis guide & checklist will help you ID areas of opportunity and expose niches where your site can beat your competition, without having to guess which “best practice” you should test next. Read this post By: Everett Sizemore September 26, 2017 How and Why to Do a Mobile/Desktop Parity Audit Advanced SEO | Search Engines | Mobile SEO You should do a mobile/desktop parity audit if content is added, removed, hidden, or changed between devices without sending the user to a new URL. When two or more versions of a website are available on the same URL a parity audit will crawl each version, compare the differences, and look for errors. Read this post
